Introduction.Description: The Wood Elves, known as the Asrai in some tales, or as the Fay Folk of Athel Loren, are a reclusive, secretive and highly isolationist race of Elves that have long ago voluntarily split off from the rest of their kin, preferring instead to live out their lives in Nature's embrace beneath the enchanted forested canopy of Athel Loren. However, other conclaves are known to exist, such as the Eonir of Laurelorn.\n\nFrom these mystical realms, the Wood Elves have learnt to dwell in concord with the seasons and the weave of life and death that binds all living things together. They are the defenders of the forest, guardians of all things natural and pure. For millennia, the Wood Elves have lived in this state of harmony, lying in wait and hidden from the prying eyes of the wider World.

Weapon.Name: A Blight of Terrors
Weapon.Description: A model with a Blight of Terror causes terror.

Weapon.Name: A Befuddlement of Mischiefs
Weapon.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Magic Missile with a range of 18", it causes the targeted unit to become subject to Stupidity in its next turn
Weapon.Description: Bound spell, Power level 3. The Mischiefs are treated like a Magic Missile spell that has a range of 18". It causes the targeted unit to become subject to Stupidity in its next turn. Those units that are Immune to Psychology are immune to the effects of this spell.

Weapon.Name: A Murder of Spites
Weapon.Rule: +D6 attacks with Initiative of 4, Strength of 2 and Poisoned Attacks special rules
Weapon.Description: The model gains +D6 attacks in close combat. These are worked out at the bearer's WS, and have an Initiative of 4 and a Strength of 2. In addition, these attacks count as magical, and are Poisoned Attacks.

Weapon.Name: A Muster of Malevolents
Weapon.Rule: Additional ranged weapon with range of 6", and unleashes D6 Strength 2 shots, always hit on a 4+ and count as magical and Poisoned Attacks special rules
Weapon.Description: A muster counts as a ranged weapon that may be used in addition to any ranged weapon that the model carries. It has a range of 6", and unleashes D6 Strength 2 shots. The model counts as being a single unit Strength 1 model on foot for line of sight for this attack, and it may target a different unit than any other ranged attack made by the character. These shots always hit on a 4+ and count as magical and Poisoned Attacks. A model with Malevolents may stand and shoot with them (in addition to any other ranged weapon the model may have), even if the charging unit is outside the model's line of sightfer. it would not normally be allowed to stand and shoot because the enemy is within half its' charge range. So long as the model has a chance to be contacted by the enemy unit, the character may still stand and shoot.

Weapon.Name: An Annoyance of Netlings
Weapon.Description: In a challenge, any enemy attempting to strike a character with an Annoyance of Netlings will only hit on 6+.

Weapon.Name: A Resplendence of Luminescents
Weapon.Rule: Magical attacks
Weapon.Description: All attacks made by a character with a Resplendence of Luminescents are magical, as are those of any unit that they join.

Weapon.Name: A Lamentation of Despairs
Weapon.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Once per game any model on the board must pass a Leadership test, or else suffer D3 automatic wounds that cannot be saved by armour or Ward Saves and cannot be regenerated
Weapon.Description: Bound spell, Power level 3. One use only. Any model on the board may be targeted. The targeted model must pass a Leadership test, or else suffer D3 automatic wounds that cannot be saved by armour or Ward Saves and cannot be regenerated.

Weapon.Name: A Cluster of Radiants
Weapon.Description: Treemen Ancients and Branchwraiths only. A character with Radiants may add one extra dice to their Dispel pool in their opponent's Magic phase.

Weapon.Name: A Pageant of Shrikes
Weapon.Rule: Additional shooting attack with Strength 4, range of 18" and always hits on a 3+
Weapon.Description: In addition to any shooting attacks the model has, Shrikes confer an additional shooting attack. A Pageant of Shrikes may target a different unit than any other ranged attack made by the character, though it may only be used against a target that the character can see. A Pageant ot Shrikes is a Strength 4 ranged attack that has a range of 18" and always hits on a 3+. This shooting attack is not subject to the usual targeting restrictions apart from line of sight - it can even be used to pick out an individual character within a unit. A model may not stand and shoot with a Pageant of Shrikes.

Weapon.Name: The Spirit Sword
Weapon.Rule: Enemy that suffers one or more unsaved wounds must roll a D6 and add their Leadership, the character does the same: for each point the character wins by, his opponent loses an additional wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed, for each point his opponent wins by, the character loses a wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed
Weapon.Description: Hits by the Spirit Sword wound automatically. Any enemy that suffers one or more unsaved wounds from the Spirit Sword must roll a D6 and add their Leadership - the wielder does the same. For each point the wielder wins by, his opponent loses an additional wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed. For each point his opponent wins by, the wielder loses a wound, with no Armour Saves or Ward Saves allowed.

Weapon.Name: Daith's Reaper
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon may re-roll any failed hits in close combat. In addition, any foe wounded by this blade must re-roll any successful Armour Saves.

Weapon.Name: The Bow of Loren
Weapon.Rule: As many shoot as character have Attacks on their profile
No suffer -1 for multiple shots
Weapon.Description: This longbow allows the bearer to shoot as many times as they have Attacks on their profile. The bearer does nor suffer -1 for multiple shots.

Weapon.Name: Blades of Loec
Weapon.Description: Wardancer Weapons. The wielder can re-roll any failed rolls to wound. May be used in conjuction with the Shadow Dances of Loec.

Weapon.Name: The Dawnspear
Weapon.Rule: Then character causes an unsaved wound on an enemy, then that model and any other models in the unit that have not yet attacked suffer -1 to hit for that Combat phase
Weapon.Description: Counts as a spear. If the wielder causes an unsaved wound on an enemy, then that model and any other models in the unit that have not yet attacked suffer -1 to hit for that Combat phase.

Weapon.Name: The Spear of Twilight
Weapon.Description: This spear confers the Killing Blow ability on the wielder.

Weapon.Name: The Callach's Claw
Weapon.Rule: Any unit suffering one or more unsaved wounds suffer an additional -1 penalty to their Leadership for the remainder of the Combat phase
Weapon.Description: Any unit suffering one or more unsaved wounds from this blade suffer an additional -1 penalty to their Leadership for the remainder of the Combat phase.

Weapon.Name: The Hunter's Talon
Weapon.Rule: May target any model it can see (including a character in a unit), but if this special ability is used, will suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty
Weapon.Description: If firing non-magical arrows the wielder of this longbow may target any model it can see (including a character that could normally not be targeted because it is in a unit or not the closest target), but if this special ability is used, will suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty. Note that the normal -1 penalty for shooting at a single man-sized model does not apply and the target cannot benefit from the "Look out, sir!" rule. The shooter may always choose a different target to the unit he is with.

Weapon.Name: The Sword of a Thousand Winters
Weapon.Rule: Characters and Monsters must take a Toughness test for each unsaved wound - their Strength, Initiative and Attacks are reduced by 1 for each test they fail
Weapon.Description: Characters and Monsters must take a Toughness test for each unsaved wound they suffer from this blade - their Strength, Initiative and Attacks are reduced by 1 (to a minimum or 1) for each test they fail.

Weapon.Name: Rageth's Wildfire Blades
Weapon.Rule: Flaming attacks
Weapon.Description: Counts as two hand weapons. Any attacks made with these weapons count as Flaming.

Weapon.Name: Asyendi's Bane
Weapon.Rule: May re-roll all missed shooting attacks, if after this re-roll the shot still misses, then the bearer suffers a Strength 3 hit
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this longbow may re-roll all missed shooting attacks. However, if after this re-roll the shot still misses, then the bearer suffers a Strength 3 hit.

Armour.Name: The Oaken Armour
Armour.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. The Oaken Armour gives the wearer the Regeneration ability.

Armour.Name: Railarian's Mantle
Armour.Rule: 4+ Ward Save within 6" of a Wood
Armour.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. If the wearer is within 6" of a Wood he receives a 4+ Ward Save.

Armour.Name: Armour of the Fey
Armour.Rule: 4+ Ward Save against any magical close combat attacks
Armour.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. Against any magical close combat attacks, the wearer receives a 4+ Ward Save.

AdditionalArmour.Name: The Helm of the Hunt
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +1 Attack and +1 Weapon Skill in charge
AdditionalArmour.Description: This helm confers a 6+ Armour Save that can be combined with other equipment as normal (including normal armour and a shield). When the character charges he receives +1 Attack and +1 Weapon Skill for that round of combat.

Armour.Name: Briarsheath
Armour.Rule: Enemies wishing to target the model with a shooting attack suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty
Armour.Description: Counts as light armour (6+ Armour Save) that can be combined with other equipment as normal. Enemies wishing to target the model wearing the Briarsheath with a shooting attack suffer an additional -1 to hit penalty. This is increased to -2 if the wearer is within a wood.

AdditionalArmour.Name: The Rhymer's Harp
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May move through all kinds of difficult terrain without penalty
AdditionalArmour.Description: This item bestows a 5+ Ward Save on the bearer, their mount, and any unit they join. In addition, the bearer, their mount, and any unit they join may move through all kinds of difficult terrain without penalty.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Amaranthine Brooch
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Ward Save cannot be used against magical attacks
AdditionalArmour.Description: Grants the bearer a 3+ Ward Save that cannot be used against magical attacks.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Amber Pendant
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Enemy models in base contact automatically strike last
AdditionalArmour.Description: Any enemy models in base contact with the bearer of the Amber Pendant automatically strike last - even if they charged or have an ability that would allow them to normally strike first.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Stone of the Crystal Mere
AdditionalArmour.Rule: If Ward Save is ever failed, then the Ward Save is lost for the rest of the game
AdditionalArmour.Description: The bearer of the stone gains a 3+ Ward Save, as does any creature ridden by the bearer. However, if this Ward Save is ever failed, then the stone shatters and the Ward Save is lost for the rest of the game.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Glamourweave
AdditionalArmour.Rule: 4+ Ward Save against shooting attacks and magic missiles
Any model attempting to strike the model in close combat must first pass a Leadership test: if they fail, they require 6+ to hit the bearer during that Combat phase
AdditionalArmour.Description: The Glamourweave conveys a 4+ Ward Save against shooting attacks and magic missiles. In addition, any model attempting to strike the bearer in close combat must first pass a Leadership test. If they fail, they require 6+ to hit the bearer during that Combat phase.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Stone of Rebirth
AdditionalArmour.Description: When the wearer is reduced to one Wound this item bestows a 2+ Ward Save.

AdditionalArmour.Name: The Fimbulwinter Shard
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Any creatures with the Forest Spirit special rule suffer from Stupidity while the bearer is within 6"
AdditionalArmour.Description: Opponents suffer a -1 to hit the bearer and his mount in close combat. Any creatures with the Forest Spirit special rule suffer from Stupidity while the bearer is within 6".

AdditionalArmour.Name: Merciw's Locus
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Any model wishing to strike the model receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons
AdditionalArmour.Description: The bearer of this magic item receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons. However, any model wishing to strike the model that bears Merciw's Locus also receives no Strength bonuses from magical or non-magical weapons.

Weapon.Name: Wraithstone
Weapon.Rule: All enemy units within 6" suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership
Weapon.Description: All enemy units within 6" of the bearer of this stone suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership.

Weapon.Name: Hagbane Arrows
Weapon.Rule: Magic arrows: a model that loses one or more wounds from Hagbane arrows must take a Toughness test, if the test is failed, the target is slain, ignoring Armour Saves and Ward Saves
Weapon.Description: Magic arrows. A model that loses one or more wounds from Hagbane arrows in any Shooting phase must take a Toughness test at the end of the phase. If the test is failed, the target is slain regardless of how many wounds it has left, ignoring Armour Saves and Ward Saves.

Weapon.Name: Moonstone of the Hidden Ways
Weapon.Rule: Once per game, if the character and any unit they have joined is wholly within a wood at the end of the Move phase, the character and unit may be removed from the table and replaced anywhere that is also wholly within a wood, facing in any direction and in any formation
Weapon.Description: One use only. If the character and any unit they have joined is wholly within a wood at the end of the Move phase, the character and unit may be removed from the table and replaced anywhere that is also wholly within a wood, facing in any direction and in any formation.

Weapon.Name: Hail of Doom Arrow
Weapon.Rule: Once per game, the arrow splits into 3D6 magical Strength 4 arrows
Weapon.Description: One use only. Magic arrow. When fired, the arrow splits into 3D6 magical Strength 4 arrows. Roll to hit for each arrow. If this is used with a magic bow, then any effects of the magic bow are ignored for this shot.

Weapon.Name: Starfire Arrows
Weapon.Rule: Any unit that suffers one or more casualties from model shooting must take a Panic test, regardless of the number of casualties caused
Weapon.Description: Magic arrows. Any unit that suffers one or more casualties from Starfire Arrows must take a Panic test, regardless of the number of casualties caused.

Weapon.Name: The Horn of the Asrai
Weapon.Rule: One per game, at the beginning of any enemy turn, all enemies able to charge the bearer of this item must take a Leadership test, if they fail, they must charge the bearer
Weapon.Description: One use only. Can be used at the beginning of any enemy turn. When used, all enemies able to charge the bearer of this item must take a Leadership test. If they fail, they must charge the bearer (charge reactions. Psychology tests etc. are taken as normal).

Weapon.Name: Arcane Bodkins
Weapon.Rule: Magic arrows with no Armour Saves are allowed
Weapon.Description: Magic arrows. No Armour Saves are allowed against Arcane Bodkins.

Weapon.Name: Elynett's Brooch
Weapon.Description: The wearer, and any unit they join, may re-roll failed Psychology tests.

Weapon.Name: Dragontooth Arrows
Weapon.Rule: Any model wounded by Dragontooth Arrows suffers from the rules for Stupidity for the rest ot the game
Weapon.Description: Any model wounded by Dragontooth Arrows suffers from the rules for Stupidity for the rest ot the game - even if they are normally Immune to Psychology.

Weapon.Name: Gwytherc's Horn
Weapon.Rule: Once perl game, the character and any unit joined become Immune to Psychology until the beginning of the next turn
Weapon.Description: One use only. At the start of any of the bearer's turns the horn may be blown. The bearer and any unit joined are Immune to Psychology until the beginning of the bearer's next turn.

Arcane.Name: Wand of Wych Elm
Arcane.Rule: Any Dispel attempt can be re-rolled
Arcane.Description: This staff allows any Dispel attempt to be re-rolled.

Arcane.Name: Calaingor's Stave
Arcane.Rule: May add 1" to the distance they may move a forest if they successfully cast the spell Tree Singing
Arcane.Description: If the bearer has the spell Tree Singing, then they may add 1" to the distance they may move a forest if they successfully cast the spell (so, if successfully cast, they may move a forest D3 + 2"). In addition, they may cast (and attempt to cast) the spell more than once per Magic phase.

Arcane.Name: Divination Orb
Arcane.Rule: If an opponent uses more than three dice when casting any spell, the character may add an extra free Dispel dice into the attempt to dispel that spell
Arcane.Description: If an opponent uses more than three dice when casting any spell, the bearer of the Divination Orb may add an extra free Dispel dice into the attempt to dispel that spell.

Arcane.Name: The Deepwood Sphere
Arcane.Rule: May re-roll the dice when determining the effects of the Tree Singing spell
All enemy models wholly or partly within the same wood as the bearer take a single Strength 5 hit at the start of each Wood Elf Magic phase
Arcane.Description: This item allows the mage to re-roll the dice when determining the effects of the Tree Singing spell (whether he is using it to move a wood or to inflict damage on an enemy within a wood). In addition, all enemy models wholly or partly within the same wood as the bearer take a single Strength 5 hit at the start of each Wood Elf Magic phase.

Arcane.Name: Ranu's Heartstone
Arcane.Rule: Once per game may re-roll one of the dice when casting a spell or making a Dispel attempt
Arcane.Description: Once per game, the bearer of this item may re-roll one of the dice when casting a spell or making a Dispel attempt. This can be used to prevent a miscast or cause a spell to be cast with Irresistible Force.

Banner.Name: The Royal Standard of Ariel
Banner.Rule: Any friendly unit within 12" of this banner receives Magic Resistance (1)
Banner.Description: The enchantment that Ariel has woven into this banner causes the bearer, and any unit he joins, to cause fear. In addition, any friendly unit within 12" of this banner receives Magic Resistance (1).

Banner.Name: Gaemrath - the Banner of Midwinter
Banner.Rule: Once per game declare the banner's use at the beginning of the Movement phase, before declaring charges, the unit may not move or march but becomes Unbreakable until the start of the next player turn
Banner.Description: One use only. Declare the banner's use at the beginning of the Movement phase, before declaring charges. The unit may not move or march but becomes Unbreakable until the start of the next player turn. This ability may be used if the unit is already engaged in close combat, but cannot be used if the unit is fleeing or skirmishing.

Banner.Name: Faoghir - the Banner of Dwindling
Banner.Rule: Enemies that flee from the unit having been beaten in close combat roll one dice less than normal to determine the distance they flee

Banner.Name: Saemrath - the Banner of the Zenith
Banner.Rule: The distance at which enemy models are prevented from marching by this unit is increased from 8" to 12"

Banner.Name: Aech - the Banner of Springtide
Banner.Rule: The unit may make a stand and shoot charge reaction even if the enemy charging them do so from within half their charge range

Lord.Name: Orion
Lord.Description: Orion, The King in the Woods

Individual.Rule: Does not suffer a -1 to hit penalty for moving and shooting

RangeWeapon.Name: Hawk's Talon
RangeWeapon.Rule: A missile weapon with the Strength 6 and can penetrate ranks as a bolt thrower, each unsaved wound become D3 wounds

Armour.Name: Horn of the Wild Hunt
Armour.Rule: Then Orion declare a first charge in game, all enemies within 18" must take a Panic test

Individual.Rule: For each wounds suffers, she gains an additional attack for remainder of the game
May cast the Tree Singing spell twince each turn

Dependencies.Off: Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Alter, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Scout
Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Alter, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Scout, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Eternal
Wardancer, Wild Rider, Waywatcher, Alter, Scout
